docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 11 (AP) -- Rear Admiral Samuel Toranzo Calderon was reported sentenced today to life imprisonment on a charge of having master-minded the June 16 revolt.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 29 -- A $5,500,000 loan has been made to develop electric power facilities in Uruguay, it was announced today by the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development. The First National City Bank of New York will put...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 29 -- A $5,500,000 loan has been made to develop electric power facilities in Uruguay, it was announced today by the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development. The First National City Bank of New York will put up $200,000 of the loan.

byline.original: By EDWARD A. MORROWSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BECAUSE of lack of faith, and sometimes lack of fuel, the German Navy's record in World War II was an uneven one, and this is an uneven book about that record. The lack of faith was Adolf Hitler's. He treated Grand Admiral Raeder like a lackey, and...
docs.lead_paragraph: BECAUSE of lack of faith, and sometimes lack of fuel, the German Navy's record in World War II was an uneven one, and this is an uneven book about that record. The lack of faith was Adolf Hitler's. He treated Grand Admiral Raeder like a lackey, and squealed in helpless rage whenever a capital ship -- invulnerable symbol to him of German might -- was lost.
docs.abstract: Bekker, C D: Defeat at Sea: The Struggle and Eventual Destruction of the German Navy, 1939-1945

headline.main: Too Little and Too Late; DEFEAT AT SEA: The Struggle and Eventual Destruction of the German Navy, 1939-1945. By C. D. Bekker. Illustrated. 222 pp. New York: Henry Holt & Co. $3.95.
